headline: Computer Engineering Student
summary: I'm a 3rd Year Student at Imperial College London studying Electronic and Information Engineering. I have keen interest in digital hardware design, verification and computer architecture. I have experience in hardware design engineering (Apple) and functional verification (Imagination Technologies).

jobPositions.title: Hardware Design Intern
jobPositions.description:
I designed and debugged RTL modules used for pre-silicon instrumentation for measuring various performance metrics about the design.
This instrumentation was designed to function in both simulation and emulation environments making simulation time and area used important factors.
This involved learning a new GPU architecture by reading architectural and micro architectural specifications. 
I wrote scripts to translate complex test vectors for high level tests into a useable for for unit tests.

projects.description:
The aim of the project was to, in pairs, create a custom instruction for the Nios 2 soft processor in hardware. It needed to be able to calculate the result of the following mathematical function as quickly as possible with minimum resource utilisation. 
- Designing a floating and fixed-point number format to preserve a specific level of precision.
- Compared the performance vs resource utilisation of two possible microarchitectures for implementing the CORIDC algorithm to calculate cos(x), rolled and unrolled and pipelined (as shown in the image). (Christos Bouganis.Topic 7 - Function Evaluation.url:https://bb.imperial.ac.uk/webapps/blackboard/execute/content/file?cmd=view&content_id=_2091313_1&course_id=_23208_1.(accessed: 29.03.2021).)
projects.title: Hardware Function Accelerator on FPGA
Architectural Optimization for Smith-Waterman Algorithm
projects.description: Found the architectural configuration of Simplescalar’s sim-outoforder CPU model that finishes a computation of the Smith-Waterman algorithm using the minimum total energy. A report was written discussing the results and justifying the optimizations attempted. Bash scripts were written to automate testing.

Built a compiler with a partner. Used FLEX and Bison to build a lexer and parser. The rest of the compiler to build an abstract syntax tree and traverse the tree to produce machine code was built using C++ in parallel by me and my partner.
projects.title: ANSI C Compiler

projects.description: Built a MIPS 1 CPU Simulator in C++ with a partner. I delegated implementation of instructions and was responsible for branch and memory related instructions, designing the memory and register system and writing the main Emulator loop.
projects.title: MIPS CPU Simulator and testbench

projects.description: Lead a team to design and implement a real time image processing system. The system allows the user to draw a picture on the screen through motion detection of an LED “brush” with a camera. This system was implemented using a PYNQ-2 board, the FPGA on the board being configured with Vivado and Vivado HLS. The system was written using C.
projects.title: Real-Time Image Processor
